titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Laura Katz Smith.

address.addressline: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Katz Smith in April 2010.

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center.
did.abstract: John Francis (Jack) O'Brien was born in Putnam, Connecticut, on March 21, 1896, and was a cable foreman for the Southern New England Telephone Company, beginning in February 1914. He died in Waterford, Connecticut, on September 19, 1983. The papers consist of photographs, correspondence and certificates, most involving Mr. O'Brien's service as a SNET employee.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: John Francis O'Brien (Jack) was born in Putnam, Connecticut, on March 21, 1896, and was a cable foreman for the Southern New England Telephone Company, beginning in February 1914. He died in Waterford, Connecticut, on September 19, 1983.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of photographs, correspondence and certificates, most involving Mr. O'Brien's service as an employee of the Southern New England Telephone Company.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in one series, organized by format.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to Connecticut business and the Southern New England Telephone Company. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This record series is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These papers were donated by Mr. W.A. MacQuarre, Mr. O'Brien's nephew, of Waverly, Nova Scotia, Canada, in April 2010.

did.unittitle: Issue of the SNET Telephone Bulletin, in which Mr. O'Brien is acknowledged for having worked for the company for 45 years,
Certificates and a letter regarding courses taken at the University of Connecticut's School of Engineering, University Extension, by Mr. O'Brien,
Scenes and employees associated with the Southern New England Telephone Company,
